awd_titl_txt: Quasi-Elastic Light Scattering Studies of Protein Refolding and Aggregation
awd_abstract_narration: Heterologous proteins produced by recombinant DNA                               technology are frequently isolated in unfolded and inactive                     forms.  These proteins must be refolded before a useful                         product is obtained.  In this proposal, a novel                                 quasi-electric light scattering (QELS) technique is                             proposed for use in studying protein refolding and                              aggregation.  Processing conditions that facilitate protein                     refolding and environmental effects on the functional                           properties of the folded proteins will be evaluated using                       beta-galactosidase as a model protein.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
